title: Performance Analysis by Equipment Type
purpose: Break down PermaFrost performance data by equipment type, age, and operating characteristics
data_source: Analysis of 133 case studies from comprehensive_measurements.json. Equipment types extracted from 116 of 133 records (remaining 3 lack identifiable equipment type in source PDFs).

centrifugal.notes: Large capacity, significant absolute dollar savings

reciprocating.notes: Older technology, often high improvement potential

key_insights: Chillers show highest absolute dollar savings due to size
Water-cooled chillers typically show higher efficiency gains than air-cooled
Multi-stage/screw chillers often show improvements at partial load
Oil-flooded screw compressors particularly responsive to treatment

standard_efficiency.notes: Often older units with significant oil fouling

high_efficiency.notes: Newer units still benefit from treatment

key_insights: High volume application - multiple units per building
Retail and commercial buildings typically have 5-20 RTUs
Chain rollouts can aggregate significant savings
Seasonal operation affects annual savings calculation
Smaller individual savings but high unit counts
Common in light commercial and residential applications
Mini-splits/VRF systems - growing segment with limited data
Data center precision cooling application
24/7 operation maximizes annual savings
Directly impacts PUE (Power Usage Effectiveness)
Critical cooling - reliability paramount
24/7 operation similar to data centers
Lower temperature applications may show different response
Multi-unit installations in retail/restaurant common

dx_system.notes: Direct expansion systems not otherwise categorized

0_to_5_years.recommendation: Set realistic expectations for 15-20% improvement. Consider treatment to PREVENT degradation rather than restore it.

key_factors: Sufficient operating time for oil migration
Good balance of improvement potential and remaining life
5_to_10_years.recommendation: Excellent candidates. Equipment has accumulated fouling but remains in good condition for treatment.

10_to_15_years.recommendation: Ideal candidates. Significant fouling to address, equipment still viable for extended operation.

15_to_20_years.recommendation: Excellent improvement potential. Treatment can extend equipment life and fund future replacement.

over_20_years.recommendation: Good candidates if mechanically sound. Treatment maximizes remaining equipment value.

24_7_operation.notes: Maximum annual savings capture due to continuous operation

extended_hours.notes: Good savings with extended but not continuous operation

standard_commercial.notes: Seasonal and daily cycling reduces annual savings capture

seasonal.notes: Limited operation time extends payback period

banking_financial.notable_results: Major Global Bank A showed 17.76% sustained over 6+ years

telecommunications.notable_results: Major Telecom A, Major Telecom B, Major Telecom C installations documented

hospitality.notable_results: Hotel Chain A [Louisiana Location] and [Caribbean Location] documented

retail.notable_results: Retail Chain B, Retail Chain A, Retail Chain C installations

restaurant.notable_results: Restaurant Chain A, QSR Chain A multi-year tracking

education.notable_results: Highest average improvement of any industry segment

government_military.notable_results: Military Base A, Defense Agency A - federal validation

healthcare.notable_results: Lower % due to strict maintenance standards, but high absolute savings

pharmaceutical.notable_results: Lowest improvement % due to pharmaceutical-grade maintenance

positive_factors.reason: More time for oil fouling to accumulate
More oil residue on heat exchange surfaces
Higher oil circulation inherent to design
More operating hours to capture efficiency gains

negative_factors.reason: Fresh refrigerant may have cleaned some surfaces

key_insights: Equipment type affects FORM of results (% vs absolute $)
Equipment age is strongest predictor of improvement percentage
Operating hours determine annual savings magnitude
Industry affects maintenance standards and baseline fouling
Highest % improvements: education, entertainment, neglected equipment
Highest $ savings: chillers, data centers, 24/7 operations

best_candidates: 10-20 year old chillers in commercial buildings
proceed_with_caution: Equipment scheduled for replacement within 1 year
